a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

p.strong: The latest update can be found below. If you want to see the update below along with the previous ones, click here.

em.span: In accordance with today’s announcement from Missouri Governor Parson, all Missouri schools including Neosho School District will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Even though our buildings will be closed, the expectation is that school will continue until May 22, 2020.

We are saddened by this news for so many reasons but we understand the need and are determined to continue providing educational support and some level of normalcy for Neosho students. We will continue to provide meal options for children under the age of 18 for the length of the closure.

For the Neosho High School Class of 2020, we know this is especially disappointing as you all were likely holding out hope just as we were. As we have said, we are committed to making this time special for you and your families. It may look different or have a nonconventional timeline but it will happen. Thank you to those seniors and senior families who have completed the survey. If you have not, it is still open and we are really counting on your feedback as we work on senior events.

We know this news likely raises many questions. An update with more information is in the works to be sent out tomorrow. However, if you want to head over to our Facebook page and leave a question, we will try our best to address it in tomorrow’s update.
Please continue to be kind and patient with one another and with us as we all work through the details to come. Together we will get through it!
Thank you for your support and understanding,

p.span: All technology-related questions or requests (getting a device, charger, device repair, sign on, apps, etc.) can be directed to the helpdesk.
or 417.451.8658. The technology team has also made helpful resources for logging into devices. Those tutorials can be found here >

a.span: Instructions on how to log into Chrome browser on personal device
Instructions on how to log into an Ipad
Instructions on how to log into a Chromebook

p.strong: Educational Support Resources for Grades K-6

p.span: We have a new round of educational support resources ready for grades K-6! These resources can be

and for students who do not have internet, the schools will be mailing them home. The schools each have a list of homes without internet, but if you aren’t certain that you are on that list, please reach out to your child’s teacher or principal. Teachers will continue to reach out to individual classes for the duration of the closure.
Enrollment information is coming home for grades 7-12. Students will receive this information through their email.

a.span: This information can also be accessed on our website here.

p.span: We are working on alternative ways to enroll for students who do not have internet access.

span.p: Enrollment information for Pre-K - 6 will come at a later date.

p.span: NSD families who are using district Chromebooks and iPads, just a reminder that the devices are intended for educational purposes. We are thankful that we can provide our students with the opportunity to continue learning but want to remind everyone that devices are monitored by district filters. Inappropriate or concerning use, searches, or language will alert our technology department and counseling services department. Our counselors will review the content and if there appears to be a concern, a counselor will contact the family. For questions regarding device oversight, parents can contact their school counselor or our Director of Counseling Services, Tracy Clements, at clementstracy@neoshosd.org. Distance learning will be most successful if students are encouraged to work in a centralized location at home and a specific device time is implemented.
NSD will continue to provide meals to Neosho youth ages 18 and under. Those interested in receiving meals are welcome to

nearest them during the appropriate time. At this time, we do not need new recipients to complete a form as we are preparing based on daily participation. We do ask that if families plan to pick up meals frequently, they will be consistent with the meal pick up point. The consistency will help our Food Service team as they prep and continue to provide this amazing service.

As of right now we have plenty of volunteers helping with the meal pick up points. Should we need more, we will send out communication. Thank you to those who are volunteering and have offered - we appreciate you!

April is National Child Abuse Awareness Month. If you are concerned for a child’s safety, call the Missouri Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline at 1-800-392-3738. This is a toll-free telephone line that is answered 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. If a child is in immediate danger, please call 911.
